1.text: And know this: that in the last days perilous times will press near.

2.text: Men will be lovers of themselves, greedy, self-exalting, arrogant, blasphemers, disobedient to parents, ungrateful, wicked,

3.text: without affection, without peace, false accusers, unchaste, cruel, without kindness,

4.text: traitorous, reckless, self-important, loving pleasure more than God,

5.text: even having the appearance of piety while rejecting its virtue. And so, avoid them.

6.text: For among these are ones who penetrate houses and lead away, like captives, foolish women burdened with sins, who are led away by means of various desires,

7.text: always learning, yet never achieving knowledge of the truth.

8.text: And in the same manner that Jannes and Jambres resisted Moses, so also will these resist the truth, men corrupted in mind, reprobates from the faith.

9.text: But they will not advance beyond a certain point. For the folly of the latter shall be made manifest to all, just as that of the former.

10.text: But you have fully comprehended my doctrine, instruction, purpose, faith, longsuffering, love, patience,

11.text: persecutions, afflictions; such things as happened to me at Antioch, at Iconium, and at Lystra; how I endured persecutions, and how the Lord rescued me from everything.

12.text: And all those who willingly live the piety in Christ Jesus will suffer persecution.

13.text: But evil men and deceivers will advance in evil, erring and sending into error.

14.text: Yet truly, you should remain in those things which you have learned and which have been entrusted to you. For you know from whom you have learned them.

15.text: And, from your infancy, you have known the Sacred Scriptures, which are able to instruct you toward salvation, through the faith which is in Christ Jesus.

16.text: All Scripture, having been divinely inspired, is useful for teaching, for reproof, for correction, and for instruction in justice,

17.text: so that the man of God may be perfect, having been trained for every good work.
